sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: captoinfo (link to tic), clear, infocmp, infotocap (link to tic), reset (link to tset), tack, tic, toe, tput and tset.

sect4.title: captoinfo
sect4.para: captoinfo converts a termcap description into a terminfo description.

sect4.title: clear
sect4.para: clear clears the screen if this is possible. It looks in the environment for the terminal type and then in the terminfo database to figure out how to clear the screen.

sect4.title: infocmp
sect4.para: infocmp can be used to compare a binary terminfo entry with other terminfo entries, rewrite a terminfo description to take advantage of the use= terminfo field, or print out a terminfo description from the binary file (term) in a variety of formats (the opposite of what tic does).

sect4.title: infotocap
sect4.para: info to cap converts a terminfo description into a termcap description.

sect4.title: reset
sect4.para: reset sets cooked and echo modes, turns off cbreak and raw modes, turns on new-line translation and resets any unset special characters to their default values before doing terminal initialization the same way as tset.

sect4.title: tack
sect4.para: tack is the terminfo action checker.

sect4.title: tic
sect4.para: tic is the terminfo entry-description compiler. The program translates a terminfo file from source format into the binary format for use with the ncurses library routines. Terminfo files contain information about the capabilities of a terminal.

sect4.title: toe
sect4.para: toe lists all available terminal types by primary name with descriptions.

sect4.title: tput
sect4.para: tput uses the terminfo database to make the values of terminal-dependent capabilities and information available to the shell, to initialize or reset the terminal, or return the long name of the requested terminal type.

sect4.title: tset
sect4.para: tset initializes terminals so they can be used, but it's not widely used anymore. It's provided for 4.4BSD compatibility.

sect3.title: Library Files
sect3.para: libcurses.[a,so] (link to libncurses.[a,so]), libform.[a,so], libform_g.a, libmenu.[a,so], libmenu_g.a, libncurses++.a, libncurses.[a,so], libncurses_g.a, libpanel.[a,so] and libpanel_g.a

sect4.title: libcurses, libncurses++, libncurses, libncurses_g
sect4.para: These libraries are the base of the system and are used to display text (often in a fancy way) on the screen. An example where ncurses is used is in the kernel's make menuconfig process.

sect4.title: libform, libform_g
sect4.para: libform is used to implement forms in ncurses.

sect4.title: libmenu, libmenu_g
sect4.para: libmenu is used to implement menus in ncurses.

sect4.title: libpanel, libpanel_g
sect4.para: libpanel is used to implement panels in ncurses.
